title: Moscow jails US-Russian citizen for treason, donating $50 to pro-Ukraine charity
content: Ksenia Karelina, a 32-year-old US-Russian citizen, was sentenced to 12 years in a Russian prison for donating $50 to a pro-Ukraine charity. She was detained in Yekaterinburg in January. The Russian court charged her with high treason, claiming the funds were used to support Ukrainian armed forces. The United States criticized the arrest as baseless.
summary: Ksenia Karelina, a 32-year-old US-Russian citizen, was sentenced to 12 years in a Russian prison for donating $50 to a pro-Ukraine charity. She was detained in Yekaterinburg in January. The Russian court charged her with high treason, claiming the funds were used to support Ukrainian armed forces. The United States criticized the arrest as baseless.

title: Belgian woman found abandoned on Pakistan's Independence Day, allegedly raped for five days
content: A Belgian woman in her mid-20s was allegedly raped for five days and found abandoned in Islamabad's Sector G-6/1-3 on Pakistan's Independence Day. She claimed to have been living with a man who assaulted her. The Belgian embassy is aiding the investigation, but her identity remains unconfirmed. Medical examination is ongoing.
summary: A Belgian woman in her mid-20s was allegedly raped for five days and found abandoned in Islamabad's Sector G-6/1-3 on Pakistan's Independence Day. She claimed to have been living with a man who assaulted her. The Belgian embassy is aiding the investigation, but her identity remains unconfirmed. Medical examination is ongoing.

title: Mobs vowing to 'guard revolution' attack ex-Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina's supporters with rods
content: Supporters of ousted Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina were attacked as they attempted to rally at the anniversary of her father's assassination. The interim government, led by Muhammad Yunus, aims to hold elections soon and has invited UN investigators to probe the violence that led to Hasina's removal, which resulted in numerous deaths and detentions.
summary: Supporters of ousted Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina were attacked as they attempted to rally at the anniversary of her father's assassination. The interim government, led by Muhammad Yunus, aims to hold elections soon and has invited UN investigators to probe the violence that led to Hasina's removal, which resulted in numerous deaths and detentions.

title: New Zealand PM wants defence shakeup, focus on 'traditional' allies
content: New Zealand will shakeup its defence forces and "reset" its foreign policy to align with traditional allies, the country's prime minister said Thursday. "The foundation of our foreign policy reset is our collaboration with longstanding partners," Luxon told the Lowy Institute, a foreign policy think tank in Sydney, Australia.
summary: New Zealand will shakeup its defence forces and "reset" its foreign policy to align with traditional allies, the country's prime minister said Thursday.  "The foundation of our foreign policy reset is our collaboration with longstanding partners," Luxon told the Lowy Institute, a foreign policy think tank in Sydney, Australia.

title: This city is America’s worst place to live in 2024 - Here's why
content: In a recent poll by Clever, Washington, DC was ranked as the least desirable city in the US due to high living costs and rising crime rates. About 33 per cent of respondents placed it among their top five least desirable cities, while cities like New York and Los Angeles were also ranked low. Tampa, Florida, topped the desirability ranking for 2024.
summary: In a recent poll by Clever, Washington, DC was ranked as the least desirable city in the US due to high living costs and rising crime rates. About 33 per cent of respondents placed it among their top five least desirable cities, while cities like New York and Los Angeles were also ranked low. Tampa, Florida, topped the desirability ranking for 2024.

Meghan Markle rumoured to be planning explosive tell-all memoir
content: Meghan Markle is reportedly considering a revealing memoir to share her experiences with the royal family amid rising tensions. This speculation follows Prince Harry's 2023 memoir and recent CBS interview. Sources claim Meghan feels pressured to 'take the gloves off' and provide her perspective, potentially making a significant financial impact and answering public questions.

Japan set to lift 'megaquake' warning
content: Japan lifted a week-old alert about a potential 'megaquake' that could cause enormous damage and casualties. The warning had led to panic buying and holiday cancellations. The Japan Meteorological Association issued the caution following a magnitude 7.1 quake. Despite lifting the alert, officials stressed the ongoing risk and urged regular preparedness checks.
summary: Japan lifted a week-old alert about a potential 'megaquake' that could cause enormous damage and casualties. The warning had led to panic buying and holiday cancellations. The Japan Meteorological Association issued the caution following a magnitude 7.1 quake. Despite lifting the alert, officials stressed the ongoing risk and urged regular preparedness checks.

Will JD Vance and Tim Walz debate? All you need to know
content: A vice-presidential debate between Republican JD Vance and Democrat Tim Walz remains uncertain. CBS News proposed four dates, but Vance has not confirmed participation, citing conditions like a live audience. With the election nearing, both candidates have shown interest in debates. Walz is eager, but scheduling and conditions are still under discussion.
summary: A vice-presidential debate between Republican JD Vance and Democrat Tim Walz remains uncertain. CBS News proposed four dates, but Vance has not confirmed participation, citing conditions like a live audience. With the election nearing, both candidates have shown interest in debates. Walz is eager, but scheduling and conditions are still under discussion.

title: Japan's first-ever megaquake advisory: What does it mean?
content: Japan issued its first "megaquake advisory" after a 7.1 magnitude earthquake hit Kyushu's southeastern coast on August 8. Concerned about possible stronger quakes in the Nankai Trough, the government and public are urged to brace for future seismic activity. Prime Minister Fumio Kishida cancelled his trip to address the situation.
summary: Japan issued its first "megaquake advisory" after a 7.1 magnitude earthquake hit Kyushu's southeastern coast on August 8. Concerned about possible stronger quakes in the Nankai Trough, the government and public are urged to brace for future seismic activity. Prime Minister Fumio Kishida cancelled his trip to address the situation.

title: US elections: Is Kamala Harris trying to distance herself from Biden? Critics call campaign 'fake'
Kamala Harris surges ahead of Trump in 6 of 7 battleground states
content: A recent series of polls indicated that Vice President Kamala Harris showed strong momentum against former President Donald Trump in key battleground states. The surveys revealed that Harris led in most states, except for Nevada. The Cook Political Report noted Harris's lead has increased since May, highlighting her competitive edge.
summary: A recent series of polls indicated that Vice President Kamala Harris showed strong momentum against former President Donald Trump in key battleground states. The surveys revealed that Harris led in most states, except for Nevada. The Cook Political Report noted Harris's lead has increased since May, highlighting her competitive edge.

Uncertain future for ISS astronauts Wilmore and Williams: Nasa weighs SpaceX vs Boeing Starliner
content: NASA remains undecided on whether to keep astronauts Butch Wilmore and Sunita Williams at the ISS due to issues with Boeing's Starliner capsule. The astronauts might extend their stay until February 2025, potentially returning aboard SpaceX's Dragon. Boeing faced setbacks during the mission, including thruster malfunctions and helium leaks, prompting further tests in space.
summary: NASA remains undecided on whether to keep astronauts Butch Wilmore and Sunita Williams at the ISS due to issues with Boeing's Starliner capsule. The astronauts might extend their stay until February 2025, potentially returning aboard SpaceX's Dragon. Boeing faced setbacks during the mission, including thruster malfunctions and helium leaks, prompting further tests in space.

title: Google celebrates India's Independence Day with this special Doodle
content: On India's 78th Independence Day, Google featured a doodle by Vrinda Zaveri, celebrating iconic Indian architecture adorned in national colors. The doodle honored freedom fighters and highlighted Independence Day celebrations, including flag-raising ceremonies and cultural events. Google offered best wishes to the nation, continuing its tradition of creating special doodles for significant global occasions.
summary: On India's 78th Independence Day, Google featured a doodle by Vrinda Zaveri, celebrating iconic Indian architecture adorned in national colors. The doodle honored freedom fighters and highlighted Independence Day celebrations, including flag-raising ceremonies and cultural events. Google offered best wishes to the nation, continuing its tradition of creating special doodles for significant global occasions.
